definition[0]: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said
example[0]: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
example[1]: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
explanation[0]: Moreover is very formal. In everyday English, people use what’s more or also instead:
example[2]: The rent is reasonable and, what’s more, the location is perfect.
